assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes WS-BPEL in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
WS-BPEL does not directly conform with the main conditions to publish data as open data. However, this specification can be used for the consumption of open data by the definition of web services business process. 
 
WS-BPEL OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html 

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:   
https://5stardata.info/en/

The specification was developed by 2004, by OASIS, and has been evolved through different versions. The current version is the 2.0, which is available since the 2007, which demonstrates that it has overcome the possible issues hampering its use and now it is established and used. 

WS-BPEL OASIS reference:

http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

As WS-BPEL is a language used for the composition of web services, WS-BPEL helps and fosters the visibility of administration data, and services. Moreover, it eases the decision-making process by ensuring the data exchange and reuse. 

The specification: 
http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

statement: The main objective of WS-BPEL is the business process execution for web services, which helps to retrieve and consume data from different sources. However, the availability of interfaces is not the purpose of the specification, so this criterion is not applicable for this specification.

http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The specification in itself does not  include security features, but the security considerations aim to put together the benefits of the WS-BPEL and the WS-Security specifications, that can be used to secure the Web services transactions. Therefore, it can be said that the orchestration of web services combining both specifications can ensure the trustworthy data exchange between administrations and stakeholders. 

The specification: 

http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

statement: The purpose of WS-BPEL is not related to the  delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are not many studies assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency. The document provided is an empirical study on the testing of WS-BPEL web services in the current environment of web services based on the cloud. 

Study about WS-BPEL:
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8204552

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
WS-BPEL is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, WS-BPEL can define the interoperability aspects of the "Orchestration Service", and "Orchestration component" ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.



EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There is a code validator for WS-BPEL that helps developers create well-formed, valid and standard-compliant code. The code is checked for errors and the user is notified if validation fails.
 
The WS-BPEL Validator: 
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E19182-01/821-0539/cnfg_bpel-guide-validation_r/index.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
3 Member States are recommending WS-BPEL in their ICT National Catalogues. They belong to Cyprus, France and Germany.  
  
CAMSS List of Standards:   
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement: No formal agreement has been found established between organisations or administrations involved in European public service provision including the usage of WS-BPEL.

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
WS-BPEL is included in some national catalogues from Member States. A total of 3 countries listed the WS-BPEL within their national catalogues. They belong to Cyprus, France and Germany.

See CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement: WS-BPEL is not included in any catalogue of standards at supra-national level.

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: After carrying out an exhaustive research, no evidence has been found of an established agreement between organisations involved in European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement: The purpose of WS-BPEL is not related  to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of WS-BPEL is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
There are many testimonials from OASIS consistories that are a reliable example to know that WS-BPEL is a cross-sector reusable data model as it uses several XML specifications :WSDL 1.1, XML Schema 1.0, XPath 1.0 and XSLT 1.0. XML Schema type definitions provide the data model used by WS-BPEL processes.

The specification:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/OS/wsbpel-v2.0-OS.html

assessment_title: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Web Services Business Process Execution Language (WS-BPEL) v2.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement: Even WS-BPEL is fostering the first level of maturity provided by Tim Berners-Lee's 5 stars schema for publication of Open data, it is not supports the principles to be considered as fostering actor on publishing Linked Open Data.
